intro: Crepis nestmeieri, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and yellowish flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Crepis nestmeieri is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to withstand cold and harsh climatic conditions.
